thread.title: Arsenal news: Santi Cazorla injury rules him out for the rest of season | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Santi Cazorla injury rules him out for the rest of season | Metro News

author: Chris Davie For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Santi Cazorla injury rules him out for the rest of season | Metro News
text:
Santi Cazorla ruled out for the rest of Arsenal’s season gossip Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 8:59 am Santi Cazorla will miss the rest of Arsenal’s season. (Getty Images) 
Santi Cazorla has been ruled out for the rest of the season, according to reports. 
The Daily Mail claims that the 32-year-old will not play another game this term as he continues his recovery from an Achilles tendon injury. 
The Spaniard last featured for Arsenal in their 6-0 victory over Ludogorets Razgrad on October 19 and was initially rested after swelling formed in his ankle. 
But after missing a month of action, Cazorla needed surgery to fix the problem at the start of December. Cazorla has been sidelined since October 16. (Getty Images) 
Following his operation, Arsenal estimated that Cazorla would be sidelined for around three months, but Arsene Wenger revealed at the start of January that the midfielder’s recovery was taking longer than expected.
